author: RichardS
content: Bullish: Call me nuts, but this stock will soon go back and challenge its recently made high.

author: Robert
content: Bullish: When we experience a down day like today, I must remind myself that AMZN is not an ordinary stock.  76% of AMZN shares are owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.  Add to that day-traders, then the rest of us must be very nimble to the daily fluctuation.  Still hoping AMZN will bust out by year’s up.  Keeping the faith here.

author: BigMac
content: I've had enough..AMZN is the worst investment of my career. I cant believe I sold Apple to buy this garbage stock. They will never let it run.

author: BlueBee
content: Bullish: Market makers and bottom feeders will be back tomorrow they have created a new buying opportunity.

author: j
content: Bullish: I'm gunna need you guys to step it up around here, folks this is unacceptable!

author: Joe D
content: Bearish: No one can afford these lackluster gains going into a recession. More sell off coming.

author: bret
content: This too shall pass. It’s all a joke see u at 230 in February

author: Kaz
content: haBullish: hang tight and ignore the noise. this is a great company and will move higher over time.😊

author: Jaime
content: Bullish: People just don't understand the true value of this stock. They get all rattled with the day to day shifts. If you buy and hold long-term,  you will make money. Just look at the history charts. It's all in plain sight. I'm holding my 600 shares and letting this thing do its magic....🤑

author: Sandro
content: Bullish: This is a joke. No rational as to why the price is dropping. This is a good reason to load up as AI integration will be rewarding in the future

author: eastside
content: Neutral: Actually a bit disappointed that AMZN can’t hold 200

author: scott
content: Bearish: What now? This piece of junk never can hold a rally, never break out, now with tariffs coming? I'm out...off to another stock, good luck all, over 4 years and nothing in one of the best bull markets ever...Thanks Bezos for selling and thanks for nothing.
